result.execSummary:
The defendant Lorenzo S Gooden was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
IMPOSED & STAYED.  AMENDED 04-01-2019:  CFTS (previous credit granted was duplicate to credit already received in 08CF1469)

AMENDED 03-01-2022:  Due to concurrent language, CFTS granted.
Concurrent with: Any other sentence he is serving (AMENDED 03-01-2022)

IMPOSED & STAYED   AMENDED 03-01-2022:  Concurrent to any other sentence serving.
Consecutive to: time being served if revoked

miscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment and after care. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment. Must comply with all child support orders. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law unless sample has been previously provided, however, defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

timeConds.notes:
May serve at Milwaukee House of Corrections. Huber is granted for employment only. Do not report late or under the influence of alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Absolute sobriety is required.
Concurrent with: time currently being served

For the Defendant to come from Milwaukee Secure Detention Facility to Court on 12-23-15 at 9:00 AM.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant  NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances - bond condition(s) to be monitored by Zimmerman Consulting Inc., located at 524 S Main Street in Racine (262-632-1780).  You are to report to their office immediately following your hearing.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance. Must make all court appearances on time.   Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
Preliminary hearing at 12-23-2015 09:00 am

Defendant Lorenzo S Gooden in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Defendant Lorenzo S Gooden in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set. The State indicates that the deft was shot the night before the final pretrial and has been held at Milwaukee Secure Detention so the State asks that the BW be vacated and bond be reinsstated. In the new file, recommends $1,000.00 cash. Defense asks for $500.00 cash.

BTC: Bond in 15CF1853 to be set at $1,000.00 cash. NO alc/cs - ZCI testing and after every court appearance. Make all court appearances on time.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 23, 2015 at 09:00 am.
